delivery_focus_notes: Entry trim – focus on basic controls, SmartSense safety, phone pairing, simple audio and climate, no advanced luxury features.
Adds more convenience (keyless, nicer interior touches) – highlight drive modes if equipped, upgraded infotainment, and extra USB/power options.
Top Venue – emphasize LED lighting, sunroof (if equipped), navigation/upgraded screen, and any extra driver-assist features vs SE/SEL.
Entry trim – same core Venue delivery: controls, SmartSense basics, phone pairing, simple climate. Call out that AWD is not available.
Single higher trim for 2026 – cover style upgrades, H-Tex/cloth seating if present, two-tone roof and cosmetic changes, plus same tech as SE.
Base Kona – explain digital cluster, basic safety, drive modes, phone pairing, and simple climate/audio; no sunroof or advanced camera systems.
Adds comfort features (heated seats, more USBs, possible roof rails) – show convenience features and any extra SmartSense items.
Step up trim – highlight larger screen, more driver-assist features (HDA, etc. where equipped), push-button start and keyless access.
Sport appearance – emphasize sport styling, wheel/tire differences, paddle shifters if equipped; same core tech as mid trims.
Sport-focused – tour N Line styling, possible sport seats and tuning; still cover daily-use features first (safety, phone, cruise).
Top gas Kona – emphasize full digital cockpit, Surround View (if equipped), power/ventilated seats, premium audio, and sunroof.
Entry EV – focus on charging basics, range display, regen modes, scheduled charging, climate vs range, and smartphone app connectivity.
Adds heated seats, power driver seat, roof rails, more comfort – cover same EV fundamentals plus extra comfort switches and memory where present.
Performance-styled EV – explain same EV controls with extra attention to drive modes, sport feel, N Line interior/exterior and premium audio.
Top EV – highlight advanced driver assistance, surround/parking cameras if equipped, Bose audio, ambient lighting, power seat/memory.
Base 2026 Kona – focus on updated interior, digital screens, SmartSense basics, phone pairing, drive modes.
Adds more style and features – cover upgraded wheels, convenience features, and any added driver assists vs SE.
Comfort-focused – emphasize H-Tex seats, larger wheels, upgraded cluster, and extra comfort/tech for daily use.
Top trim – show all tech: big screens, advanced safety suite, ambient lighting (if equipped), sunroof, and premium audio.
Base Tucson – focus on 12.3-inch touchscreen, SmartSense safety, basic cruise control, drive modes, phone pairing, climate controls.
Adds heated seats, 8-way power driver seat, dual auto climate, wireless charging – demonstrate seat/comfort settings and Digital Key if equipped.
Highlights: 12.3-inch cluster, nav, ambient lighting, sunroof – cover cluster customization, navigation, HDA, and liftgate if included.
Adventure look – show tow hitch, cladding, possible AWD setup, terrain-related drive modes, and roof features while still covering tech basics.
Sporty trim – emphasize N Line styling, sport seats, paddles if available; delivery still prioritizes safety systems and infotainment first.
Top gas Tucson – cover HUD (if equipped), Surround View, Remote Smart Parking Assist, leather seats, ventilated seats, Bose audio, panoramic roof.
Efficiency-focused hybrid – explain hybrid system behavior, EV mode, regen, fuel economy screens; show same safety/infotainment basics as SE/SEL.
Comfort + efficiency – highlight added tech (bigger screens, HDA), hybrid energy info, and smart liftgate if included.
Sportier hybrid – emphasize performance feel of hybrid plus N styling, but cover hybrid-specific displays and charge/regen behavior first.
Top hybrid – same Limited tech (HUD, SVM, RSPA, Bose, leather/vent seats) plus hybrid-specific range/energy displays.
PHEV – focus hard on charging, EV range, charging ports, charge settings, and mode switching; then standard Tucson tech & safety.
Fully loaded PHEV – combine PHEV delivery (charging, EV mode, scheduling) with full Limited suite (HUD, premium audio, cameras, luxury touches).
Base 2026 Tucson – similar to 2025 but updated; focus on revised interior, large screens, SmartSense, phone pairing, basic cruise.
Adds comfort/convenience; cover heated seats, power seat, extra safety items, and any Digital Key or wireless charging.
Adventure trim – emphasize appearance + light off-road readiness, tow options, AWD configuration, while not skipping tech/safety walkthrough.
Near-top – highlight extra luxury/tech over SEL: more cameras, nicer interior, possibly sunroof and advanced HDA.
Top 2026 gas Tucson – full tech suite; focus on HUD (if fitted), Surround View, RSPA, ambient lighting, premium audio and seat comfort.
Base hybrid for 2026 – explain hybrid system first, then standard safety and 12.3-inch display behavior.
Mid hybrid – blend comfort and efficiency; cover hybrid energy screens plus upgraded interior features vs Blue.
More loaded hybrid – treat like Limited-lite: more cameras, more tech, still hybrid-focused delivery on efficiency and regen.
Top hybrid – same Limited feature walk as gas but with emphasis on hybrid powertrain, energy usage displays and EV-like behavior.
Carry-over PHEV SEL – charging and EV mode explanation first, then Tucson features; stress plug-in charging vs standard hybrid.
Top PHEV SEL – combines full PHEV explanation with Limited-level comfort and tech features.
New body style – explain seating configuration, drive selector, safety systems, phone pairing, and basic drive modes.
Adds convenience (heated seats, more tech) – cover comfort controls and any liftgate settings.
More rugged – explain roof rails, towing, terrain-oriented drive modes; treat tech similar to SEL.
Luxury-leaning – focus on leather, ventilated seats, sunroof, advanced cameras and audio, cluster customization.
Top luxury – same Limited items plus maximum soft-touch/premium details; emphasize ambient lighting and highest driver-assist package.
Hybrid – explain powertrain, EV mode, regen, and energy screens; then same SEL comfort/tech as gas.
Upscale hybrid – combine hybrid delivery with Limited luxury (leather, cameras, audio, seats).
Top hybrid – emphasize quietness, range, comfort, ambient lighting, full safety suite and HUD if equipped.
2026 update – call out new 8-speed auto vs old DCT, then same essential delivery: controls, safety, phone, drive modes.
Adds comfort/convenience vs SE – highlight interior upgrades, heated seats, and liftgate options.
Rugged trim – emphasize appearance, towing, AWD, and terrain drive modes, still covering safety and phone basics.
Near-top – focus on advanced cameras, HUD (if present), upgraded seats and interior materials.
Top gas – full luxury; walkthrough of all comfort/tech features plus driver profiles, ambient lighting, and seat/memory.
Hybrid SEL – same as 2025 hybrid SEL delivery: power split explanation, regen, energy screens, and comfort tech.
Hybrid Limited – combine hybrid talk with Limited-level tech and seating.
Hybrid Calligraphy – flagship; focus on quiet hybrid drive, full luxury cabin, and full active safety stack.
Base three-row – cover seating controls, rear climate, safety systems, basic cruise, and phone pairing for families.
Adds more comfort and seat options (captain’s chairs available) – show 2nd/3rd row access, USBs, and power seat adjustments.
Rugged appearance – explain roof/tire aesthetic, towing, and HTRAC AWD usage for family trips.
Family comfort trim – focus on 2nd-row comforts, available sunroof(s), and extra tech versus SEL.
Luxury – walkthrough of leather seating, surround view, HUD (if equipped), premium audio, seat ventilation/heating.
Top luxury – emphasize highest-end interior, ambient lighting, unique wheels, and full driving-assist features.
Appearance variant – same features as Calligraphy with dark styling; focus more on look differences, same tech walkthrough.
New-gen Palisade – bigger footprint; cover dual 12.3-inch displays, safety basics, seat/fold functions, and HTRAC overview.
Adds comfort – show 2nd-row upgrades, power seats, and family-focused features.
More tech – emphasize extra driver assists, upgraded screens, and convenience features vs SEL.
High-content gas trim – focus on near-luxury interior, sunroof, and camera features.
Off-road styled – explain appearance, tow capabilities, HTRAC modes, while still doing full tech/safety overview.
Premium gas – highlight leather, ambient lighting, cameras, HUD (if equipped), and premium audio.
Top gas – full luxury; focus on comfort, quietness, and full driver assistance stack.
Entry hybrid – emphasize hybrid operation, EV crawl in traffic, range, and how HTRAC behaves with hybrid system.
Hybrid SEL – same as Blue SEL with more comfort/tech; show energy screens and EV/engine transitions.
Comfort-heavy hybrid – focus on long-trip comfort, charging (regenerative only), and family amenities.
Premium hybrid – blend hybrid-fuel savings explanation with Limited luxury tech.
Top hybrid – ultimate comfort + hybrid system; make sure to show all driver-assist and display customization.
Base sedan – cover SmartSense basics, basic cluster, cruise, phone pairing, and simple climate/audio layout.
Adds features and slightly sportier look – highlight extra comfort and wheel upgrades vs SE.
More tech – emphasize larger screen, more safety tech, possibly sunroof and wireless charging.
Sport variant – explain turbo engine behavior, drive modes, paddle shifters, and sport seats while still showing safety basics.
Top gas Elantra – cover full safety suite, leather, Bose audio (if equipped), and digital cluster customization.
Efficiency trim – explain hybrid system, EV mode, regen, and fuel-economy coaching screens.
Mid hybrid – mix of efficiency and comfort; cover extra features beyond Blue and how they affect daily driving.
Top hybrid – add luxury/tech walk to hybrid explanation (leather, sunroof, premium audio, full safety).
Updated 2026 Elantra – same base delivery: controls, SmartSense, phone, simple cluster.
Adds equipment over SE – explain extra comfort/safety, wheels, and tech.
Higher-content SEL – treat like prior SEL Convenience; highlight dual 12.3-inch displays where equipped, nav, and advanced safety.
Top 2026 Elantra – walk through all tech, cluster modes, leather, and driver-assist settings.
Entry – show new styling, 12.3-inch display, SmartSense, basic cruise, and phone pairing.
Adds comfort and features; highlight keyless entry, heated seats, and convenience upgrades vs SE.
Big tech jump – emphasize dual screens, nav, wireless charging, and extra driver-assist features.
Performance trim – turbo engine, N transmission, sport seats; cover performance features but still teach safety/assist systems clearly.
Hybrid – explain gauge cluster energy flow, EV mode, and efficiency tips plus typical SEL comforts.
Top hybrid – add leather, panoramic roof, Blind-Spot View Monitor, and Remote Smart Parking Assist walkthrough to hybrid basics.
Base – explain truck bed features, underfloor storage, tailgate use plus standard SUV-style safety/infotainment.
Adds convenience (heated seats, keyless) – highlight bed utility plus comfort upgrades.
Turbo AWD adventure trim – explain engine difference, AWD system, and extra tow/off-road aids.
Top trim – cover HDA, Surround View, Blind-Spot View Monitor, premium audio, and all bed/utility tricks.
Base 2026 – same delivery as 2025 SE with updated content; focus on bed usage, safety, and phone pairing.
Adds comfort – show heated seats, keyless access, and infotainment upgrades.
Activity/“Night”-style trim – emphasize lifestyle accessories, appearance, and added convenience features.
Turbo AWD – stress performance, towing, and AWD modes plus full tech/safety walkthrough.
Full luxury Santa Cruz – focus on all camera systems, HDA, leather, and premium audio.
Base battery – teach charging (home/DC), range, route planning, and basic infotainment; rear-motor only.
Larger pack – emphasize range upgrade, available AWD, and same EV interface; show charge scheduling and climate preconditioning.
Adds comfort/tech (power seats, upgraded interior) – highlight HDA, wireless charging, and interior ambient touches.
Adventure-themed – show appearance, possible AWD, tow rating, and utility while keeping EV training first.
Top trim – cover full HUD, premium audio, ventilated seats, full camera suite, and most advanced driver assistance.
High-performance EV – emphasize N drive modes, N e-Shift, track functions, launch control, while still teaching day-to-day EV use, charging, and safety.
Similar trim structure with lower pricing – same EV delivery, mention included dual-amperage charger and new color options.
Same as 2025 SE – emphasize range, AWD availability, and charging.
Mid trim – comfort/tech step up; same delivery as 2025 SEL.
Adventure EV – focus on AWD and outdoors usage plus EV fundamentals.
Top 2026 – full luxury and tech; same delivery pattern as 2025 Limited.
Carry-over performance EV – stress N features and track vs street settings.
Base battery – explain aero sedan range advantage, charging, EV screens, and drive modes.
Bigger pack – same EV training plus more range; mention RWD vs AWD choice.
Adds comfort tech – show extra driver assists, interior upgrades, and any audio/lighting enhancements.
Top trim – emphasize full safety suite, HUD (if equipped), premium audio, and seat comfort.
Similar structure – EV basics unchanged; updated styling if present.
Mid-range – same EV explanation plus more comfort than SE SR.
Higher content – more driver-assist and interior upgrades.
Top comfort/tech – same delivery pattern as 2025 Limited.
High-performance sedan – explain N dual-motor power, N Grin Boost, performance modes, while emphasizing everyday range/charging and safety.
Base 3-row EV – explain 3-row layout, 110 kWh battery, single-motor RWD, charging, and family safety/tech basics.
AWD SE – add explanation of dual-motor AWD vs S; focus on traction and weather confidence.
More comfort and tech – highlight seating upgrades, extra driver-assist, and more premium feel.
Performance AWD – emphasize higher output, possible larger wheels/tires, while still focusing on family usability and range.
Top luxury – full interior upgrade + performance; focus on refinement, quietness, and full tech suite.
Style-focused flagship – same feature content as Performance Calligraphy with unique design touches; deliver as ultimate premium family EV.
